wikipedia_page.main: Reverend Herbert Richard Peel (1831–1885) was an English clergyman. He played cricket for Oxford University and Kent County Cricket Club. He also worked to popularise apiculture.

response: On 10 January 1884 at Thornton, Buckinghamshire, he married Alice (1854-1942), eldest daughter of  the Reverend Herbert Richard Peel (1831-1885), a nephew of the prime minister Sir Robert Peel, 2nd Baronet,  and his wife Georgiana Maria (1830-1907), daughter of the Reverend Thomas Baker. Alice's sister Amy married the Reverend James Henry Savory, a cricketer for Oxford and MCC and an FA Cup finalist in football.

On 25 February 1886 at Thornton, Buckinghamshire, he married Amy (1859-1929),1886, quarter 1, vol. 3A, p. 691 second daughter of the Reverend Herbert Richard Peel and his wife Georgiana Maria, daughter of the Reverend Thomas Baker. His wife's older sister, Alice, married Arthur Howard Heath. With Amy he had two daughters, Gladys Rebe Savory (1887-1947) and Ethel Mary Savory (1888-1958), who did not marry.
